STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 15, 2024
Kyle Rambo
CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OF THE UPPER PENINSULA
427 S STEPHENSON AVE STE 215, Suite 215
IRON MOUNTAIN, MI, 49801-3458
Re: License #: CB220201016
Dear Mr. Rambo:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
04/12/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI, 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records.
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are
unrelated to the staff person.
One of six employee files did not contain references.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(h) Documentation from the department that the
person has not been named in a central registry case
as the perpetrator of child abuse or neglect in
Michigan or in any state where the person lived in
the 5 years preceding hire.
One of six employee files did not have a central registry clearance from Wisconsin
where the employee currently resides.
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
2

Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
• Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor,
when siblings in care are placed apart. • Parents who
are a member of a participating household. • Youth
ages 14 and older. • Foster parents, relative
caregivers, and unrelated court ordered caregivers
Three foster care files and nine service plans were reviewed. Four of nine treatment
plans were not signed or were signed more than thirty days from the date of the
service plan. Therefore, the signature pages were not uploaded into the electronic
case record within 30 days of the report date.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
05/09/2023 Renewal, CAP approved 05/30/2023.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in
the electronic case management record using the
FTM hyperlink within seven business days of the
FTM.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three files did not have the uploaded
FTM within 7 days.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
Technical assistance was provided in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incidents reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those
incidents named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of CAPS. The agency was informed that starting January 1,
2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will be reviewed with the agency at
three months and six months. The assigned Consultant for the agency will
work with the agency in conducting CAP reviews. This process for special
investigation CAP reviews was implemented previously.
3

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted an approved corrective action plan (CAP) on May 30, 2023,
in response to rule violations established during the renewal inspection completed
on May 9, 2023. The current interim inspection established one repeat violation.
The CAP was sucessful in preventing a repeat violation of the one other rule cited
in the renewal inspection pertaining to sending renewal applications late.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was submitted and reviewed. The
assessment was comprehensive. The assessment noted successes during the
year as well as barriers. Barriers to complying with policy and rules included the
recruitment and training of staff which can be difficult in rural areas of the upper
peninsula. Also noted were DHHS reporting requirements as well as contractual
language which place additional burdens on staff. The agency covers a wide
geographical area which can also be a challenge. Though the agency is small, the
quality of the team and workers was noted.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed including a certified public accountant audit of the
agency. No concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed report feeling supported by the agency administration. Each staff
reported they are a small agency, and everyone works well together and are
supportive of one another.
4

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst did not establish any safety alerts during her visits to the homes.
She reported that relatives feel supported by the agency and are satisfied with
services.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
May 9, 2024
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 15, 2024
________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
